Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether Article 1F(b) of the Refugee Convention is unconstitutionally vague under Charter s.7
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) Section 98, incorporating Article 1F(b) of the Refugee Convention
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of Immigration and Refugee Board decision
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's evidence found unreliable and self-serving
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA Section 98, Article 1F(b) of the Refugee Convention
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Refugee protection based on fear of persecution
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Serious reasons for considering that a serious non-political crime was committed
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of credibility in applicant’s evidence
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Admissibility hearing, followed by judicial review
Crimes.Decision_Maker: Immigration and Refugee Board, reviewed by Federal Court
Crimes.Application_Error: Misrepresentation and fraud in original visa application
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Standard less than balance of probabilities but more than mere suspicion
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None identified; court found evidence properly assessed
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Exclusion from refugee status under Article 1F(b)
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Constitutionality of IRPA s.98 and procedural fairness
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Alleged serious non-political crime and fraud
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: No breach found regarding translation, adjournment, or bias
Crimes.Relevant_Law: Charter of Rights and Freedoms s.7

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Exclusion from refugee status due to inadmissibility for overstaying and alleged fraud
Crimes.Governing_Law: IRPA Section 98, Article 1F(b) of the Refugee Convention
Crimes.Application_Facts: Entered on visitor visa, overstayed, claimed refugee status
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Remained in Canada after visa expiry
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution in country of origin
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Serious reasons for considering commission of serious non-political crime
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Credibility of applicant and reliability of evidence
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk of return to country of origin not outweighed by criminal inadmissibility
Crimes.Cause_Description: Overstay and alleged fraud leading to admissibility hearing
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Failed to comply with temporary resident conditions
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Present in initial entry and stay
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Serious reasons to believe applicant committed serious crime

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Constitutional and procedural challenge to exclusion from refugee status
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether Article 1F(b) is unconstitutionally vague under Charter s.7
Crimes.Governing_Law: IRPA s.98, Article 1F(b) of the Refugee Convention
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On Minister to show serious reasons for belief
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Central to determination; applicant found not credible
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Article 1F(b) excludes individuals who committed serious non-political crimes
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Alleged translation errors, bias, denial of adjournment
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution due to political opinion
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Applicant’s testimony and lack of corroboration

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Constitutional challenge to inadmissibility for fraud
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether IRPA s.98 is unconstitutionally vague under Charter s.7
Crimes.Governing_Law: IRPA s.98, Article 1F(b) of the Refugee Convention
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of Board decision on admissibility
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Refugee protection due to fear of persecution
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Serious reasons for considering commission of serious crime
Crimes.Application_Error: Misrepresentation in visa and refugee applications
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: More than suspicion, less than balance of probabilities
Crimes.Application_Factor: History of fraud in home country and Canada
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Central to decision; applicant not believed
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Alleged bias, translation issues, denial of adjournment
